intro: Koellensteinia florida, commonly known as the Florida starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Koellensteinia florida is an important species for pollinators and is considered a rare, endangered plant in its native range.
